com.l2fprod.common.swing
Class StatusBar

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              com.l2fprod.common.swing.StatusBar
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable
public class StatusBar
extends javax.swing.JComponent

StatusBar.
A status bar is made of multiple zones. A zone can be any JComponent.

See Also:
Serialized Form

 void addZone(java.lang.String id, java.awt.Component zone, java.lang.String constraints)
          Adds a new zone in the StatusBar
 java.awt.Component getZone(java.lang.String id)
           
 void setZoneBorder(javax.swing.border.Border border)
           
 void setZones(java.lang.String[] ids, java.awt.Component[] zones, java.lang.String[] constraints)
          For example: setZones(new String[]{"A","B"}, new JComponent[]{new JLabel(), new JLabel()}, new String[]{"33%","*"}); would construct a new status bar with two zones (two JLabels) named A and B, the first zone A will occupy 33 percents of the overall size of the status bar and B the left space.

public void addZone(java.lang.String id,
                    java.awt.Component zone,
                    java.lang.String constraints)
Adds a new zone in the StatusBar

Parameters:
id -
zone -
constraints - one of the constraint support by the PercentLayout

getZone

public java.awt.Component getZone(java.lang.String id)

setZones

public void setZones(java.lang.String[] ids,
                     java.awt.Component[] zones,
                     java.lang.String[] constraints)
For example: setZones(new String[]{"A","B"}, new JComponent[]{new JLabel(), new JLabel()}, new String[]{"33%","*"}); would construct a new status bar with two zones (two JLabels) named A and B, the first zone A will occupy 33 percents of the overall size of the status bar and B the left space.

Parameters:
ids - a value of type 'String[]'
zones - a value of type 'JComponent[]'
constraints - a value of type 'String[]'
